reviews.review_msg: Very straightforward class and she makes the concepts simple! I suck at genetics and I got a D when I took it with Verheyen since her lectures were packed with material. The amount of content expected to know was MUCH more reasonable in this class. Gives you practice exams that give you a very good idea of what to expect. So thankful this time.

She is such a great prof. Makes sure that you understand the concept more than just memorizing facts. Good at pointing out errors of the previous classes which makes for very good hints towards exam questions.  Uses clickers in class which gives instant feed back on understanding and you get marks for just going to class

Exams are exactly like the tutorials. Based on problems rather than memorizing definitions or multiple choice. Overall do the tutorials and if you need help ask. If you do this, this class is an easy A.

Kevin was the best prof I ever had at sfu. He is so organized and outlines exactly what you need to know. He is truly a great teacher, i've never understood material so well. His exams are harder but he sets you up well for them giving TONS of his old exams so you know what to expect.

He is an amazing professor and really cares about his students. He provides soooo much practice material, and the secret to doing well is to use most of it. Exams will include 1 or 2 questions that you haven't seen before so be prepared to study concepts on a deeper level to answer those questions too. In class questions are very helpful too.

Although I got a horrible grade in the course, I still respected Kevin's teaching as he's there to TEACH and maximize our learning. He uses research-based teaching and incorporates SEL into our lectures. Made us feel welcomed into the class and was super approachable. Study hard using his materials!
idk what to say other than hes great. Makes it so you dont have to buy iclicker. Provided a lot of resources for the midterm but not as much for the final.
amazing
Best Prof at SFU without a doubt. Genuinely cares about the students and wants you to pass. Tests are clearly outlines what to learn although the tests are tough

Kevin is amazing, any student who has him as a prof is in good hands. BISC202 in general is a tough class in terms of material, but Kevin did everything to make 202 stress free and he succeeded. W/ my heavy course load, 202 was the class I stressed about the least and the class I looked forward to the most

Dr. Lam is one of the nicest profs I have ever met. The class is not the easiest however, he definitely does a good job teaching it. Keep up with the course as it is hard to catch up once fallen behind.

The best professor I've ever had. Kevin is always encouraging us, motivating us and making sure we are all doing well. His lectures are sometimes really heavy but he makes sure that we all understand before moving on. The course is not easy so get ready to work super hard and practice lots. Exams and grades are very fair. He is amazing I love him.
the class is hard but Kevin is very clear about what we wants and is always ready to help. he is one of the few professors I've had that actually care about how you do and want you to do well.
meow

Best prof I have ever. So helpful with answering my questions. He gave us the option to go in person or watch lectures online. He records office hour questions and uploads it with time stamps of the answers. He gives you past tests to practice on so you know what to expect. 5.1/5 on RMP seems like a error. Trust me, it is not.

Best prof you'll ever have. Kevin is very caring and will explain the material very clearly. He explains EVERYTHING in lectures, so you do not have to purchase the textbook. Hands down the best prof I have had.

Kevin Lam is the best professor Ive ever had at SFU. BISC 202 is a tough course, but Kevin makes sure you get the help and support that you need. He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. His exams are hard, but they are fair. He goes above and beyond for his students and has excellent biological knowledge and study tips/advice.

Best prof at SFU. Teaches you how to be successful in university, study approaches, and makes sure you understand the material and focuses on problem solving, rather than just blindly memorizing like every other bio course . Seems like he actually cares and wants you to be successful, take this class with him if you can!

He is an old dog with no future. Always tell his own stories in the class, so each student knows about his past. I am surprised that in Canadian culture, he still behaves like 18 century. I am sorry to say but he is jerk. Looks he is very flustered in his personal life which you can see his attitude in classes.

this is one of the profs that i really question, universitiy's hiring policies. he doesn't know how to answer questions in lectures, he seems to be undergoing depression. but an easy course, no effort required in this course, just memorize how to do questions, and ur fine.
No Comments
